newsitem.title: UK: Caradon rises as H1 profits impress.
newsitem.headline: Caradon rises as H1 profits impress.

text.p: Shares in Caradon climbed to their highest point in about three months, after the UK manufacturer released stronger-than-expected results for the first half and an optimistic outlook for next year, traders said.
At 0733 GMT, the shares were up 15-1/2p to 236-1/2p.

In what it called difficult market conditions, Caradon said it earned pre-tax profits of 81.3 million stg in the first half, down from 90.2 million stg a year ago, but above analysts' forecasts, traders said.
The dividend was unchanged at 2.9p per share.
The company said it benefited from the successful launch of new products, which along with cost cuts, would provide momentum in 1997.
"The figures were and the trading statement was very encouraging," said one market maker. "It was a big surprise."
